Class XCS

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--XCS
public class XCS
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is the XCS itself. It stores the population and the posed problem. The class provides methods for the main learning cycles in XCS distinguishing between single-step and multi-step problems as well as exploration vs. exploitation trials. Moreover, it handles the performance evaluation.

Since:
JDK1.1
Version:
XCSJava 1.0
Author:
Martin V. Butz
See Also:

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

setNumberOfTrials

public void setNumberOfTrials(int trials)
Resets the maximal number of trials in one experiment. (The default is set to 20000)

setNumberOfExperiments

public void setNumberOfExperiments(int exps)
Resets the number of experiments. (The default is set to ten.)

runXCS

public void runXCS()
Runs the posed problem with XCS. The function essentially initializes the output File and then runs the experiments.
See Also:
startExperiments(java.io.PrintWriter)

startExperiments

private void startExperiments(java.io.PrintWriter pW)
This function runs the number of experiments specified. After the initialization of the empty population, either one single- or one multi-step problem is executed.
Parameters:
pW - The print writer refers to the output file for the performance evaluation. The experiments are separated by the text 'Next Experiment'.
See Also:
XClassifierSet.XClassifierSet(int), Environment.isMultiStepProblem(), doOneSingleStepExperiment(java.io.PrintWriter), doOneMultiStepExperiment(java.io.PrintWriter)

doOneSingleStepProblemExplore

private void doOneSingleStepProblemExplore(java.lang.String state,
                                           int counter)
Executes one main learning loop for a single step problem.
Parameters:
state - The actual problem instance.
counter - The number of problems observed so far in exploration.
See Also:

doOneSingleStepProblemExploit

private void doOneSingleStepProblemExploit(java.lang.String state,
                                           int counter,
                                           int[] correct,
                                           double[] sysError)
Executes one main performance evaluation loop for a single step problem.
Parameters:
state - The actual problem instance.
counter - The number of problems observed so far in exploration.
correct - The array stores the last fifty correct/wrong exploitation classifications.
sysError - The array stores the last fifty predicted-received reward differences.
See Also:
XClassifierSet.XClassifierSet(String,XClassifierSet,int,int), PredictionArray.PredictionArray(XClassifierSet, int), PredictionArray.bestActionWinner(), Environment.executeAction(int)

doOneMultiStepProblemExplore

private int doOneMultiStepProblemExplore(java.lang.String state,
                                         int stepCounter)
Executes one learning trial in a multi-step problem. A trial normally ends when the food is reached or the teletransportation threshold is reached.
Parameters:
state - The reseted perception of the problem.
stepCounter - The number of exploration steps executed so far.
Returns:
The updated number of exploration setps.
See Also:
XCSConstants.teletransportation, XClassifierSet.XClassifierSet(String,XClassifierSet,int,int), PredictionArray.PredictionArray(XClassifierSet, int), PredictionArray.randomActionWinner(), XClassifierSet.XClassifierSet(XClassifierSet,int), Environment.executeAction(int), XClassifierSet.confirmClassifiersInSet(), XClassifierSet.updateSet(double, double), XClassifierSet.runGA(int, java.lang.String, int)

doOneMultiStepProblemExploit

private void doOneMultiStepProblemExploit(java.lang.String state,
                                          int[] stepsToGoal,
                                          double[] sysError,
                                          int trialCounter,
                                          int stepCounter)
Executes one performance evaluation trial a multi-step problem. Similar to Wilson's exploitation the function updates the parameters of the classifiers but it does not execute the genetic algorithm. A trial normally ends when the food is reached or the teletransportation threshold is reached.
Parameters:
state - The reseted perception of the problem.
stepsToGoal - The last fifty numbers of steps to the goal during exploitation.
sysError - The averaged prediction errors of the last fifty trials.
trialCounter - The number of exploration trials executed so far.
stepCounter - The number of exploration steps executed so far.
See Also:
XCSConstants.teletransportation, XClassifierSet.XClassifierSet(String,XClassifierSet,int,int), PredictionArray.PredictionArray(XClassifierSet, int), PredictionArray.bestActionWinner(), XClassifierSet.XClassifierSet(XClassifierSet,int), Environment.executeAction(int), XClassifierSet.confirmClassifiersInSet(), XClassifierSet.updateSet(double, double)

writePerformance

private void writePerformance(java.io.PrintWriter pW,
                              int[] performance,
                              double[] sysError,
                              int exploreProbC)
Writes the performance of the XCS to the specified file. The function writes time performance systemError actualPopulationSizeInMacroClassifiers. Performance and system error are averaged over the last fifty trials.
Parameters:
pW - The reference where to write the performance.
performance - The performance in the last fifty exploration trials.
sysError - The system error in the last fifty exploration trials.
exploreProbC - The number of exploration trials executed so far.
